00048 #if defined (__CYGWIN__)
00049 #include <stdio.h>
00050 #include <unistd.h>
00051 #include <sys/mman.h>
00052 #include <sys/types.h>
00053 ///  Structure alignment requirement for g++
00054 #define STRUCT_ALIGNMENT __attribute__ ((packed))
00055 #define PAGE_SHIFT      12
00056 ///  Set page size value for memory mapping used under CYGWIN
00057 #define PAGE_SIZE       (1UL << PAGE_SHIFT)
00058 ///  Set page mask value for memory mapping used under CYGWIN
00059 #define PAGE_MASK       (~(PAGE_SIZE-1))
00060 #elif defined (_MSC_VER)
00061 #include <windows.h>
00062 ///  Structure alignment requirement for g++
00063 ///  @remark Structure alignment for Visual C++ is included in #pragma
00064 #define STRUCT_ALIGNMENT
00065 #elif defined (__APPLE__)
00066 #include <stdio.h>
00067 #include <unistd.h>
00068 #include <sys/mman.h>
00069 #include <sys/types.h>
00070 #include <sys/user.h>
00071 ///  Structure alignment requirement for g++
00072 ///  @remark Structure alignment for Mac OS X is included in #pragma
00073 #define STRUCT_ALIGNMENT
00074 #else // UNIX 
00075 #include <stdio.h>
00076 #include <unistd.h>
00077 #include <sys/mman.h>
00078 #include <sys/types.h>
00079 #include <sys/user.h>
00080 ///  Structure alignment requirement for g++
00081 #define STRUCT_ALIGNMENT __attribute__ ((packed))
00082 #endif

00093 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00094 ///  typedef as CELFileEntryType
00095 ///  @brief Structure of CEL file entries for text and xda format
00096 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00097 typedef struct _CELFileEntryType
00098 {
00099         ///  Intensity
00100         float Intensity /* \cond */ STRUCT_ALIGNMENT /*! \endcond */ ;
00101         ///  Standard deviation intensity
00102         float Stdv /* \cond */ STRUCT_ALIGNMENT /*! \endcond */ ;
00103         ///  Number of pixels
00104         short Pixels /* \cond */ STRUCT_ALIGNMENT /*! \endcond */ ;
00105 } CELFileEntryType;
00106 
00107 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00108 ///  typedef as CELFileTranscriptomeEntryType
00109 ///  @brief Structure of CEL file entries for bcel format
00110 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00111 typedef struct _CELFileTranscriptomeEntryType
00112 {
00113         ///  Intensity
00114         unsigned short Intensity /* \cond */ STRUCT_ALIGNMENT /*! \endcond */ ;
00115         ///  Standard deviation intensity
00116         unsigned short Stdv /* \cond */ STRUCT_ALIGNMENT /*! \endcond */ ;
00117         ///  Number of pixels
00118   // The STRUCT_ALIGNMENT isnt needed for gcc.
00119   // and if used it generates a warning.
00120         unsigned char Pixels; /* \cond */ /* STRUCT_ALIGNMENT */ /*! \endcond */ ;
00121 } CELFileTranscriptomeEntryType;

00130 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00131 ///  affxcel::CCELFileHeaderData
00132 ///  @brief CEL file header information
00133 ///
00134 ///  @remarks Object instance is included in affxcel::CCELFileData
00135 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00136 class CCELFileHeaderData
00137 {
00138 private:
00139         ///  Magic number for identifying XDA format
00140         int m_Magic;
00141         ///  CEL file format version number
00142         int m_Version;
00143         ///  Number of columns in array
00144         int m_nCols;
00145         ///  Number of rows in array
00146         int m_nRows;
00147         ///  Number of cells in array
00148         int m_nCells;
00149         ///  Header information concatenated in a string
00150         std::string m_Header;
00151         ///  Algorithm name
00152         std::string m_Alg;
00153         ///  Algorithm parameters
00154         std::string m_Params;
00155         ///  Chip type of array
00156         std::string m_ChipType;
00157         ///  DAT header string
00158         std::string m_DatHeader;
00159         ///  Cell margin
00160         int m_Margin;
00161         ///  Number of outliers
00162         uint32_t m_nOutliers;
00163         ///  Number of masked cells
00164         uint32_t m_nMasked;
00165         ///  Grid coordinates of array
00166         GridCoordinatesType m_CellGrid;
00167 
00168         ///  STL map of algorithm parameters
00169         std::map<std::string, std::string> m_Parameters;
00170         ///  STL map of algorithm parameter keys
00171         std::map<int, std::string> m_ParameterIndices;
00172 
00173 public:
00174         /*! Constructor */
00175         CCELFileHeaderData();
00176 
00177         /*! Destructor */
00178         ~CCELFileHeaderData();
00179 
00180         /*! Clears the members */
00181         void Clear();

00187         ///  @return void       
00188         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00189         void SetMagic(int i) { m_Magic = i; }

00197

00209         ///  @return int        Version number
00210         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00212

00506 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00508 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00509 ///  affxcel::CCELFileData
00510 ///
00511 ///  @brief CEL file object
00512 ///
00513 ///  Include read and write support of the following file formats:
00514 ///  - text (version 3)
00515 ///  - xda binary (version 4)
00516 ///  - transcriptome binary (internal use only)
00517 ///  - compact binary (not supported by software other than Bruce)
00518 ///
00519 ///  All file formats include the same header information. The intensity data
00520 ///  for each cell are stored as follows:
00521 ///  - text format
00522 ///             - mean (data type: float - 4 bytes)
00523 ///             - stdev (data type: float - 4 bytes)
00524 ///             - pixels (data type: short - 2 bytes)
00525 ///  - xda binary format
00526 ///             - mean (data type: float - 4 bytes)
00527 ///             - stdev (data type: float - 4 bytes)
00528 ///             - pixels (data type: short - 2 bytes)
00529 ///  - trancriptome binary format
00530 ///             - mean (data type: unsigned short - 2 bytes)
00531 ///             - stdev (data type: unsigned short - 2 bytes)
00532 ///             - pixels (data type: unsigned char - 1 byte)
00533 ///  - compact binary format
00534 ///             - mean (data type: unsigned short - 2 bytes)
00535 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00536 class CCELFileData  
00537 {
00538 public:
00539         /// CEL file formats
00540         enum
00541         {
00542                 UNKNOWN = 0,
00543                 TEXT_CEL = 1,
00544                 XDA_BCEL = 2,
00545                 TRANSCRIPTOME_BCEL = 3,
00546                 COMPACT_BCEL = 4
00547         };
00548         
00549         /// CEL file reading states
00550         enum
00551         {
00552                 CEL_ALL=1,
00553                 CEL_DATA=2,
00554                 CEL_OUTLIER=4,
00555                 CEL_MASK=8
00556         };
00557 
00558 public:
00559         /*! Constructor */
00560         CCELFileData();
00561         /*! Destructor */
00562         ~CCELFileData();
00563 
00564 protected:
00565         /// CEL file format
00566         int m_FileFormat;
00567         /// Error string
00568         std::string m_strError;
00569         /// CEL file name without path
00570         std::string m_FileName;
00571         /// CEL file header data object
00572         CCELFileHeaderData m_HeaderData;
00573         /// Pointer to intensity entries for each cell (used for text and xda formats)
00574         CELFileEntryType *m_pEntries;
00575         /// Pointer to intensity entries for each cell (used for transcriptome bcel format)
00576         CELFileTranscriptomeEntryType *m_pTransciptomeEntries;
00577         /// Pointer to intensity entries for each cell (used for compact cel format)
00578         unsigned short *m_pMeanIntensities;
00579 
00580         /// STL map for masked cell coordinates
00581         std::map<int, bool> m_MaskedCells;
00582         /// STL map for outlier coordinates
00583         std::map<int, bool> m_Outliers;
00584 
00585         /// CEL file reading state
00586         int m_nReadState;
00587         /// Flag to determine if masked cell data should be read
00588         bool m_bReadMaskedCells;
00589         /// Flag to determine if outlier data should be read
00590         bool m_bReadOutliers;
00591 
00592 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00593         /// File handle used by CreateFileMapping in _MSC_VER
00594         HANDLE m_hFile;
00595         /// File map handle used by MapViewOfFile in _MSC_VER
00596         HANDLE m_hFileMap;
00597 #else
00598         /// Pointer to file object
00599         FILE* m_File;
00600         /// Memory mapping size used by mmap (POSIX)
00601         size_t m_MapLen;
00602 #endif
00603 
00604         /// Pointer to memory mapping data 
00605         char  *m_lpData;
00606         /// Pointer to memory mapping file view
00607         void  *m_lpFileMap;
00608 
00609         /*! Opens the file.
00610          * @param bReadHeaderOnly Flag indicating if the header is only to be read.
00611          * @return True if successful.
00612          */
00613         bool Open(bool bReadHeaderOnly = false);
00614 
00615         /*! Reads the text version of the CEL file.
00616          * @param bReadHeaderOnly Flag indicating if the header is only to be read.
00617          * @return True if successful.
00618          */
00619         bool ReadTextCel(bool bReadHeaderOnly = false);
00620 
00621         /*! Reads the XDA version of the CEL file.
00622          * @param bReadHeaderOnly Flag indicating if the header is only to be read.
00623          * @return True if successful.
00624          */
00625         bool ReadXDABCel(bool bReadHeaderOnly = false);
00626 
00627         /*! Reads the transcriptome groups custom CEL file.
00628          * @param bReadHeaderOnly Flag indicating if the header is only to be read.
00629          * @return True if successful.
00630          */
00631         bool ReadTranscriptomeBCel(bool bReadHeaderOnly = false);
00632 
00633         /*! Reads the compact binary CEL file.
00634          * @param bReadHeaderOnly Flag indicating if the header is only to be read.
00635          * @return True if successful.
00636          */
00637         bool ReadCompactBCel(bool bReadHeaderOnly = false);
00638 
00639         /*! Determines the type of CEL file. */
00640         void DetermineFileFormat();
00641 
00642         /*! Rounds a value to the nearest interger.
00643          * @param f The value to round.
00644          * @return The rounded value.
00645          */
00646         unsigned short RoundNumber(float f);
00647 
00648 public:
00649         /*! Sets the error string.
00650          * @param str The error.
00651          */
00652         void SetError(const std::string& str);
00653         void SetError(const char* str);
00654 
00655         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00656         ///  inline public  GetError
00657         ///  @brief Retrieve error string
00658         ///  @return std::string        Error string
00659         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00660         std::string GetError() { return m_strError; }
00661 
00662         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00663         ///  inline public  GetThisPtr
00664         ///  @brief Retrieve the pointer of the current object instance
00665         ///  @return affxcel::CCELFileData *    Pointer to current object instance
00666         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00667         affxcel::CCELFileData *GetThisPtr() { return this; }
00668 
00669         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00670         ///  inline public constant  SetFileName
00671         ///  @brief Set CEL file name 
00672         ///  @param str const char*             File name
00673         ///  @return void       
00674         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00675         void SetFileName(const char *str) { m_FileName = str; }
00676 
00677         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00678         ///  inline public constant  GetFileName
00679         ///  @brief Retrieve CEL file name
00680         ///  @return std::string        File name
00681         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00682         std::string GetFileName() const { return m_FileName; }
00683 
00684         // Accessors for header information.

00826         // Index/position conversions

00828         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00829         ///  inline public  IndexToX
00830         ///  @brief Get x coordinates from index
00831         ///  @return int        X coordinates
00832         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00833         int IndexToX(int index) { return index % m_HeaderData.GetCols(); }
00834 
00835         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00836         ///  inline public  IndexToY
00837         ///  @brief Get y coordinates from index
00838         ///  @return int        Y coordinates
00839         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00840         int IndexToY(int index) { return index / m_HeaderData.GetCols(); }
00841 
00842         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00843         ///  inline public  XYToIndex
00844         ///  @brief Convert x, y coordinates to index
00845         ///  @return int        Index
00846         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00847         int XYToIndex(int x, int y) { return XYToIndex(x,y, m_HeaderData.GetRows(), m_HeaderData.GetCols()); }
00848 
00849         /*! Maps X/Y coordinates to CEL file index.
00850          * @param x The x coordinate.
00851          * @param y The y coordinate.
00852          * @param r The number of rows.
00853          * @param c The number of columns.
00854          * @return The index to the intensity arrays.
00855          */
00856         static int XYToIndex(int x, int y, int r, int c)
00857         {
00858                 return ((y*c) + x);
00859         }

01011         /*! Determine CEL file format and call appropriate function to read file using the specified file name.
01012          * @param filename The name of the file.
01013          * @param nState Reading state 
01014          * @return bool true if success, false if fail
01015          *
01016          * \a nState can be one or combination of the following values:
01017          *       CEL_ALL      Read all information in file (default)
01018          *       CEL_DATA     Read header and intensities only
01019          *               CEL_OUTLIER  Read header, intensities and outliers
01020          *               CEL_MASK     Read header, intensities and masked cells
01021          */
01022         bool ReadEx(const char *filename=0, int nState=CEL_ALL);
